question: If a company has “Trade Receivables”, this implies that __:
option1: It has made a sale but yet to collect payments
option2: It has received payments but yet to make a delivery
option3: It has received an order but yet to make delivery
option4: None of the above is a correct definition
answer: It has made a sale but yet to collect payments
explanation: If a company has receivables, this means it has made a sale but has yet to collect the money from the purchaser.
